newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Logic plans HK$30 mln convertible bonds.
newsitem.headline: Logic plans HK$30 mln convertible bonds.

text.p: Logic International Holdings Ltd said on Tuesday it plans to issue 1,000 convertible bonds to raise HK$30 million to repay bank borrowings and for general working capital.

Waterside Holdings Ltd, a unit of China Resources Enterprise Ltd, agreed to subscribe for 600 bonds at HK$30,000 each and Birdfield Investment Ltd, controlled by Logic chairman Lai Ni Jan, agreed to subscribe for 400 bonds at the same price, it said in a statement.
Waterside and Birdfield hold 36.25 percent and 7.36 percent of Logic respectively, the office furniture distributor said.

The bonds, which carry a coupon of 8.5 percent per annum payable quarterly in arrears, could be converted into Logic shares at HK$0.60 per share at any time during their two-year tenor, the company said.
The conversion price represented a premium of about 22.45 percent over the closing price of HK$0.49 last Wednesday.
Logic said if all the initial bonds were converted, 50 million shares would be issued, representing about 15.57 percent of the issued share capital of the company.
In addition to the initial bonds, Logic had the discretion to issue up to 1,000 bonds to both Waterside and Birdfield at HK$30,000 per bond at any time within a period of nine months, it added.
